intro: Ouratea hoehnei, commonly known as the Hoehne's ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a member of the Ochnaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
